results.title: An Indigenous Canadian Director Channels Traumatic Memories Into Film
results.abstract: Tracey Deer based “Beans” on her experiences as a child during the 1990 Oka crisis, a confrontation between the Mohawk people and the government.

multimedia.caption: “My biggest wish back then and even today is to be seen, to be heard, to be understood,” Tracey Deer said.
multimedia.copyright: Guoman Liao for The New York Times

results.title: Zazie Beetz and Regina King on Their Big Battle in ‘The Harder They Fall’
results.abstract: In the Netflix western, the two actresses, playing members of rival cowboy gangs, engage in an epic fight. Here, they break down the scene.

multimedia.caption: Zazie Beetz as Stagecoach Mary, who goes on to fight without a weapon.

results.title: Kristen Stewart’s Princess Diaries
results.abstract: The actress is drawing Oscar talk for her portrayal of Princess Diana in “Spencer,” a role that required the sort of performance she had never given before.

multimedia.caption: “I used to think that I needed spontaneity and anxiety to propel me into something truthful,” Kristen Stewart said of her acting evolution.
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Eternals’ Review: When Super Franchises Walk the Earth!
results.abstract: A pleasing cast and the director Chloé Zhao, who won a best picture Oscar for “Nomadland,” give Marvel’s latest a steady heartbeat.

multimedia.caption: The gang’s all here: from left, Kumail Nanjiani, Lauren Ridloff, Don Lee, Angelina Jolie, Richard Madden, Salma Hayek, Gemma Chan, Lia McHugh, Brian Tyree Henry and Barry Keoghan.

results.title: ‘Spencer’ Review: Prisoner of the House of Windsor
results.abstract: Kristen Stewart stars as an anguished, rebellious Princess Diana in Pablo Larraín’s answer to “The Crown.”

multimedia.caption: Kristen Stewart stars as Princess Diana in “Spencer.”

results.title: ‘The Harder They Fall’ Review: A New Look for the Old West
results.abstract: Jeymes Samuel’s film is a bloody horse opera with a charismatic cast.

multimedia.caption: Zazie Beetz, left, with Jonathan Majors in “The Harder They Fall.”

results.title: Benedict Cumberbatch and the Monsters Among Us
results.abstract: The actor is earning some of the best reviews of his career for his turn as a vicious bully in “The Power of the Dog.” Here’s what it took to become that seething cowboy.
des_facet: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain (Movie)

multimedia.copyright: Robbie Lawrence for The New York Times

results.title: Watch the 1960s Come Alive in ‘Last Night in Soho’
results.abstract: Edgar Wright narrates a dreamy sequence from his film featuring Thomasin McKenzie and Anya Taylor-Joy.

results.title: Winter Movies 2021: Here’s What’s Coming Soon to Streaming and Theaters
results.abstract: Get ready for originals like “House of Gucci” and “C’mon C’mon” or franchise updates like “The Matrix Resurrections” and “Ghostbusters: Afterlife.”

multimedia.caption: Lady Gaga has murder on her mind as the ex-wife of a fashion heir in “House of Gucci,” due Nov. 24.

results.title: The Glory of Nina Mae McKinney, an Early Black Star in White Hollywood
results.abstract: With the 1929 “Hallelujah!,” the actress shot to stardom. Hollywood made sure she didn’t stay there, as a new Film Forum series shows.

multimedia.caption: Nina Mae McKinney in a scene from “Hallelujah!”

results.title: Billy Crystal to Return to Broadway in ‘Mr. Saturday Night’
results.abstract: The musical, about a comedian’s rise and fall, plans to open at the Nederlander Theater in the spring.

multimedia.caption: Billy Crystal in 2020. His previous Broadway show, “700 Sundays,” was an autobiographical one-man play that opened in 2004.
multimedia.copyright: Vivien Killilea/Getty Images For Palm Springs International Film Festival

results.title: The ‘Rust’ Shooting Spurs a Debate Over Using Guns on Film Sets
results.abstract: Alec Baldwin, who fatally shot a cinematographer with a gun he had been told was safe, has called for productions to hire police officers to monitor gun safety.
org_facet: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees

multimedia.caption: The fatal shooting on the set of “Rust” in New Mexico last month has prompted a debate about the use of real firearms in film and television productions.

results.title: New Initiative Aims to Change How Movies Portray Muslims
results.abstract: An advocacy group has created a worker database with help from Disney to bring more Muslims into the filmmaking process.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Ali’s Wedding” (2017), which was cited in a report about Muslims in movies as having “the only present-day Muslim lead.”

results.title: Dean Stockwell, Child Actor Turned ‘Quantum Leap’ Star, Dies at 85
results.abstract: He appeared alongside Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly when he was not yet 10. He later had signature roles in movies like “Married to the Mob” and “Blue Velvet.”

multimedia.caption: Mr. Stockwell as an eccentric criminal in David Lynch’s film “Blue Velvet,” from 1986.

results.title: Joe Pera and the Surprising Pleasures of Gentle Humor
results.abstract: Don’t expect twists in these bits. The standup, who will be at the New York Comedy Festival, has devised a calming aesthetic with rewards of its own.
des_facet: Joe Pera Talks With You (TV Program)

multimedia.caption: Joe Pera is the rare comic who will say that he doesn’t mind if you fall asleep listening to him.

results.title: ‘Sooryavanshi’ Review: Cops on a Crusade
results.abstract: The latest in Rohit Shetty’s Bollywood cop franchise is both overstuffed and paper-thin.

multimedia.caption: Akshay Kumar in “Sooryavanshi.”

results.title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a gangster shoot-em-up, a post-apocalyptic zombie/cannibal thriller, a World War II film and more.

multimedia.caption: Gerard Butler in “Copshop.”

results.title: ‘Les Éternels’: les super-franchises redescendent sur Terre
results.abstract: Après “Nomadland", Oscar du Meilleur Film, la réalisatrice Chloé Zhao s’essaie au blockbuster avec le dernier-né des Marvel, un casting séduisant à l’appui.

multimedia.caption: Le groupe au complet, de gauche à droite: Kumail Nanjiani, Lauren Ridloff, Don Lee, Angelina Jolie, Richard Madden, Salma Hayek, Gemma Chan, Lia McHugh, Brian Tyree Henry et Barry Keoghan.

results.title: Remaking Diana: Six Faces of a Princess to Stream Online
results.abstract: The film “Spencer” is the latest in a long line of TV and movie depictions of Diana. Here’s a selection.

multimedia.caption: Kristen Stewart in “Spencer,” which comes to theaters Friday.

results.title: What to Know About ‘Eternals’
results.abstract: Who are they? How long have they been here? Where do they fit in the Marvel Cinematic Universe? We have answers.

multimedia.caption: From left, Kumail Nanjiani, Lia McHugh, Gemma Chan, Richard Madden, Angelina Jolie and Don Lee in “Eternals,” directed by Chloé Zhao.

results.title: ‘Love Hard’ Review: Seeking Connection, Not Perfection
results.abstract: When a perennially single journalist travels across the country to meet her dream guy, she finds she’s been catfished.

multimedia.caption: Nina Dobrev in “Love Hard.”

results.title: Review: ‘The Visitor’ Lags Behind the Times
results.abstract: The new musical, based on the 2008 film and delayed by the pandemic, debuts at the Public Theater. But its story of a white professor helping immigrants feels out of step with the moment.

multimedia.caption: David Hyde Pierce, left, as Walter and Ahmad Maksoud as Tarek in the musical “The Visitor” at the Public Theater.

results.title: ‘North by Current’ Review: The Mornings After a Family Nightmare
results.abstract: In this documentary, the filmmaker Angelo Madsen Minax reckons with the loss of his niece, his vibrant sister’s rocky recoveries and being transgender in a traditional, Mormon environment.
des_facet: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)

multimedia.caption: A scene from the documentary “North by Current,” directed by Angelo Madsen Minax.

results.title: ‘Hive’ Review: In the Aftermath of War, a Survivor Finds Herself
results.abstract: In a tough, taut drama, the director Blerta Basholli explores the lives of women whose husbands went missing in the Kosovo War.

multimedia.caption: Yllka Gashi in Blerta Basholli’s “Hive.”

results.title: ‘A Man Named Scott’ Review: Bending Genres, Coping With Struggles
results.abstract: This film about Kid Cudi is that rare musician-focused documentary, one as sensitive, fully formed and noble in its intentions as the artist himself.

multimedia.caption: Kid Cudi in the documentary “A Man Named Scott.”

results.title: Meryl Streep for President
results.abstract: Meryl Streep explains how she prepared to play a fictional (and not especially competent) U.S. president in Adam McKay’s apocalyptic satire “Don’t Look Up.”

multimedia.caption: Meryl Streep as President Orlean, a commander in chief very focused on her approval ratings in “Don’t Look Up.”

results.title: ‘Tick, Tick … Boom!’: A Musical Based on a Musical About Writing a Musical. We Explain.
results.abstract: Lin-Manuel Miranda’s directorial debut is an adaptation of a show by Jonathan Larson, creator of “Rent.” This guide unpacks the many layers.

multimedia.caption: Andrew Garfield as Jonathan Larson in the film version of “Tick, Tick … Boom!”

results.title: ‘All Is Forgiven’ Review: A Distinctive First Feature
results.abstract: A father with a drug problem tries to reconnect with his daughter.

multimedia.caption: Victoire Rousseau and Paul Blain in “All Is Forgiven,” directed by Mia Hansen-Love.

results.title: ‘Finch’ Review: Three for the Road
results.abstract: Tom Hanks, a dog and two robots take a post-apocalyptic road trip in this unexciting drama from Apple TV+.

multimedia.caption: Tom Hanks plays a character with a robot friend in “Finch.”

results.title: Review: ‘This Is Not a War Story,’ Nor Does Coming Home Mean Peace
results.abstract: This poignant drama directed by and starring Talia Lugacy follows a traumatized Marine as she tries to connect with a group of fellow veterans at home.
des_facet: This Is Not a War Story (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Sam Adegoke and Talia Lugacy in “This Is Not a War Story.”

results.title: ‘A Cop Movie’ Review: When a Uniform Is a Costume
results.abstract: This strange and ambitious Mexican film plays like a combination of “Cops,” “F for Fake” and “When Harry Met Sally.”

multimedia.caption: Mónica Del Carmen in “A Cop Movie.”

results.title: ‘Beans’ Review: Growing Up Fast in the ’90s
results.abstract: A middle school student comes of age during a standoff between the police and Mohawk residents during the 1990 Oka crisis in Canada.

multimedia.caption: Kiawentiio as Beans and Rainbow Dickerson as Lily, her mother, in “Beans.”

results.title: ‘Mark, Mary & Some Other People’ Review: Till Death Do They Waffle
results.abstract: In this romantic comedy, a couple opens their relationship to prove they can be married and modern.

multimedia.caption: Hayley Law, left, with Ben Rosenfield in “Mark, Mary & Some Other People.”
